interferencesSchema.description:
It is essential to highlight that the nervous system is the first to develop in vitro during the third gestation and acts as the main conductor of information between different parts of the body. In fact, the development of all other parts of the body depends on a healthy nervous system.

Our goal is to optimize and rebalance the function of the nervous system to improve your health, reduce your ailments, and enhance your quality of life and sense of well-being.

Regardless of your age, the spine is the root of our health and requires attention throughout life. Therefore, people of all ages come to our chiropractic center in Ruzafa in search of better health.

toWho.title: Chiropractic is for You
toWho.description: Chiropractic is for all ages, from children to the elderly, and through all stages of life. Here, we love to attend to all family members.

science.title: Chiropractic under Science
science.body:
A study of 2,818 patients who received chiropractic treatment in the United States and worldwide showed that chiropractic care is associated with a profound and statistically significant improvement in areas of well-being. Patients report changes in: physical well-being, decreased perceived stress levels, enjoyment of life, lifestyle changes, emotional well-being, psychological well-being, and quality of life.

Blanks, RH; Boone, WR; Schmidt, S; Dobson, M; Network Care: A retrospective outcomes assessment. 1996 Dobson, M; Boone WR; Blanks, RH; Women and Alternative Health Care: A retrospective study of recipients of Network Care. 1996

graph.title: Chiropractic adjustments have been shown to improve:

items.title: What is chiropractic and how can it benefit my health?
items.body: Chiropractic is a healthcare approach focused on the nervous system and spine. It can not only improve conditions like scoliosis, lower back pain, neck pain, headaches, fibromyalgia, sciatica, etc. but it can also enhance the overall function of the body, promoting well-being.

items.title: What are the common health problems treated by chiropractic?
items.body: Chiropractic addresses a variety of issues such as back, neck, head, ankle, arm, elbow, wrist pain... rib pain, hip pain, leg pain, knee pain, postural problems, sciatica, carpal tunnel syndrome, stiff neck, rheumatism, arthritis, joint pain, impingement, calcifications, fibromyalgia, scoliosis, sports injuries, heartburn, palpitations, gastrointestinal issues, respiratory problems...

items.title: How do I know if chiropractic is right for me?
items.body: Chiropractic is safe for most people, as it is a non-invasive treatment. Additionally, before starting the care plan, we conduct an assessment of each patient individually and tailor the care plan to each individual.

items.title: What is a typical chiropractic session like?
items.body: Chiropractic sessions typically include evaluation, specific adjustments, and recommendations for home care, such as exercises and postures.

items.title: Is the adjustment done in a closed room or are there more people?
items.body: Many chiropractors use open rooms with multiple tables where they move from patient to patient. The problem is that they don't focus on one patient, so they have worse results. Also, sessions are usually short, around 5 minutes or less. In our chiropractic center, we have a first visit room and two adjustment rooms, where we spend between 20 and 30 minutes per adjustment and patient, and we are always flexible. Our mission is to help people, and that's why we have results with all our patients.

items.title: Does chiropractic only treat back pain?
items.body: Although chiropractic is effective for back pain, it also addresses a variety of health issues, including headaches, migraines, digestive problems, and stress.

items.title: How many chiropractic sessions will I need?
items.body: The number of sessions depends on the specific problem and how the patient responds to care. We develop personalized care plans for each patient. Some patients feel relief after the first session, while others may need several. Improvement is usually noticeable after the first or second session.

items.title: Is chiropractic care long-term?
items.body: The duration of care varies depending on the condition and the patient's goals. Some people choose chiropractic as part of improving their quality of life and well-being, while others seek to alleviate specific pains.

appointmentSection.description:
Schedule an appointment for our chiropractors to assist you.
Our patients have improved thanks to our chiropractic adjustments.

whatIs.title: What is Scoliosis?
whatIs.description:
Scoliosis, a distinctive medical condition, manifests as an abnormal curvature of the spine. Unlike the typical straight alignment, the spine deviates forming curves in "S" or "C". This atypical inclination can occur in various locations along the spine and vary in intensity.

This disorder can occur at different stages of life, being more common during adolescence, a period of rapid growth. Scoliosis can be classified into various types, such as idiopathic (of unknown cause), congenital (present from birth), neuromuscular (related to neuromuscular disorders), degenerative (caused by natural wear and tear of the joints), and other more specific types that we will explain further.

symptoms.title: Scoliosis Symptoms
symptoms.description:
Early detection of scoliosis is crucial for effective treatment. Some common indicators of this condition include:

  1. Uneven shoulder height: One visible symptom is the discrepancy in shoulder height, as the spine may lean laterally.
  2. Asymmetry of the shoulder blades: The shoulder blades may exhibit an irregular arrangement, with one being more prominent or displaced compared to the other.
  3. Uneven waist: The formation of an abnormal curve in the spine can lead to asymmetry in the waist, visible when observing body alignment.
  4. Deviation of the spine: As scoliosis progresses, the spine deviates to one side, adopting the characteristic "S" or "C" shape.
  5. Muscle discomfort: Some individuals may experience muscle discomfort in the back due to the strain exerted by the abnormal curvature.

types.title: Types of Scoliosis and Their Variants
types.description:
1. Idiopathic Scoliosis

Mysterious and pervasive: This type, constituting the majority of cases, still challenges a complete understanding of its causes. It mainly manifests during adolescence and is subdivided into adolescent idiopathic scoliosis and adult idiopathic scoliosis.

2. Congenital Scoliosis

From the beginning: Present from birth, this variant originates due to vertebral malformations during fetal development. Early detection is crucial for effective interventions.

3. Neuromuscular Scoliosis

Intricate connections: Results from neuromuscular disorders such as cerebral palsy or muscular dystrophy, where the complex interaction between the nervous system and muscles plays a central role in curvature progression.

4. Degenerative Scoliosis

Wear and challenges: Primarily affecting adults, it develops as a result of the natural wear and tear of the spinal joints. Over time, it can lead to significant curvatures.

5. Functional Scoliosis

Compensation and adaptation: Often associated with muscular imbalances or asymmetries in the legs, functional scoliosis develops as the body's response to certain biomechanical challenges.

6. Neurovascular Scoliosis

Exploring vascular connections: This type of scoliosis is linked to alterations in the vascular system, where the relationship between blood circulation and the spine can influence curvature.

7. Myofascial Scoliosis

Considering tissues: Myofascial scoliosis is characterized by imbalances in the connective tissues and muscles surrounding the spine, influencing its alignment.

Specific Variants of Scoliosis

Within scoliosis variants, we can find:

  1. Multiple Scoliosis: Some individuals may experience curvatures in multiple sections of the spine, creating unique challenges in treatment.
  2. Dorsal Scoliosis: The curvature is located in the dorsal region of the spine, presenting specific characteristics that require specialized attention.
  3. Lumbosacral Scoliosis: When the curvature spans the lumbar region and extends to the sacrum, it is classified as lumbosacral scoliosis, presenting particular considerations in treatment.
  4. Dorsolumbar Scoliosis: This variant affects the dorsal and lumbar regions of the spine, generating unique challenges that must be addressed comprehensively.
  5. Cervical Scoliosis: The curvature is located in the cervical region of the spine, requiring specific approaches to maintain mobility and relieve tension in this delicate area.

Understanding the variety of scoliosis types, including these specific variants, is essential for accurate diagnosis and treatment tailored to individual needs. In the following sections, we will explore how chiropractic addresses each type of scoliosis, providing personalized and improvement-oriented approaches to enhance quality of life.

chiropracticBenefits.title: Discovering the Benefits of Chiropractic in Scoliosis Treatment
chiropracticBenefits.description:
1. Spinal Alignment and Postural Correction:

  • Chiropractic adjustments aim to correct vertebral subluxations, promoting proper alignment of the spine.
  • Improving posture is essential in scoliosis treatment, and chiropractic focuses on aligning the spine to reduce abnormal curvature.

2. Reduction of Muscle Tension:

  • Chiropractic addresses uneven muscle tension associated with scoliosis, helping to reduce fatigue and discomfort.
  • Using specific techniques, chiropractors alleviate the burden on affected muscles, providing relief and improving mobility.

3. Stimulation of the Nervous System:

  • Chiropractic adjustments positively impact the nervous system, enhancing communication between the brain and body.
  • A healthier nervous system facilitates the body's adaptation to vertebral curvature, optimizing overall function.

4. Customized Approach to Each Type of Scoliosis:

  • In our Chiropractic Center, we adapt chiropractic adjustments to the specific characteristics of each type of scoliosis, offering personalized treatments.
  • The versatility of chiropractic allows addressing variants, including multiple, dorsal, lumbosacral, dorsolumbar, and cervical scoliosis.

5. Improvement of Mobility and Flexibility:

  • Chiropractic aims to improve spinal mobility, counteracting stiffness associated with scoliosis.
  • Through specific techniques, flexibility is promoted, allowing greater adaptability of the spine to postural changes.

6. Holistic Focus on General Well-being:

  • Beyond physical correction, chiropractic adopts a holistic approach considering the individual's overall health.
  • Factors such as nutrition, lifestyle, and emotional well-being are addressed to complement scoliosis treatment.

7. Pain Reduction and Improvement in Quality of Life:

  • Many of our patients experience a significant reduction in scoliosis-related pain after receiving chiropractic adjustments.
  • By improving spinal function and reducing muscle strain, chiropractic contributes to an overall enhancement in quality of life.

items.title: Is Chiropractic Effective for the Treatment of Scoliosis in Adults?
items.body: Yes, chiropractic can be effective in adults with scoliosis. Chiropractic adjustments can help improve vertebral alignment and reduce muscle tension, providing relief and promoting mobility.

items.title: How Can Chiropractic Help in the Treatment of Scoliosis?
items.body: Chiropractic addresses scoliosis through adjustments that aim to correct vertebral subluxations, improve posture, and reduce the load on affected muscles. This contributes to better alignment and function of the spine.

items.title: Can Scoliosis be Completely and Permanently Cured with Chiropractic?
items.body: Chiropractic does not claim to 'cure' scoliosis completely and permanently, but it can help improve symptoms, posture, and quality of life. It is important to work in collaboration with other healthcare professionals for a comprehensive approach.

items.title: How Long Can It Take to See Results with Chiropractic in Scoliosis?
items.body: The duration to see results varies depending on the severity and type of scoliosis. Some patients experience relief from the early sessions, while others may require a longer-term approach for sustained benefits.

items.title: Can Chiropractic be Applied to Different Types of Scoliosis?
items.body: Yes, chiropractic can be adapted to various types of scoliosis, including scoliosis in adults, idiopathic scoliosis, degenerative scoliosis, among others. Chiropractors adjust their techniques according to the specific needs of each patient.

items.title: Are There Complementary Exercises Recommended with Chiropractic for Scoliosis?
items.body: Yes, some chiropractors may suggest specific exercises to strengthen and improve the flexibility of the muscles surrounding the spine. These exercises can be part of a comprehensive treatment plan.

items.title: What is the First Step to Initiate Chiropractic Treatment for Scoliosis?
items.body: The first step is to schedule a consultation with a chiropractor specialized in scoliosis treatment. During the consultation, your condition will be assessed, and a personalized treatment plan will be discussed based on your needs.

whatIs.title: What is Neck and Head Pain?
whatIs.description:
Neck and head pain is a condition that affects the neck and head region, causing discomfort ranging from pulsating pain to stiffness and dizziness. This discomfort can arise due to various reasons such as poor posture, injuries, muscle tension, or even problems in the alignment of the spine.

In addition to the causes mentioned above, other factors may contribute to neck and head pain. Stress and anxiety are common factors that can cause tension in the muscles of the neck and shoulders, thereby exacerbating discomfort. Lack of physical activity or a sedentary lifestyle can also weaken the neck muscles, increasing susceptibility to these pains.

Modern technology also plays a significant role in the development of neck and head pain. Prolonged use of electronic devices, such as smartphones and computers, can result in a hunched posture that exerts additional pressure on the cervical spine. This phenomenon, known as text neck or tech neck, has led to an increase in cases of neck pain related to excessive use of digital devices.

symptoms.title: Symptoms of Neck and Head Pain
symptoms.description:
In addition to persistent neck pain, people experiencing this type of pain often report stiffness in the cervical area. Recurrent headaches, especially in the front or back of the head, are also common. In some cases, neck tension can cause dizziness and a feeling of imbalance. Another common symptom associated with neck pain is the radiation of discomfort to the shoulders and arms. This sensation can manifest as a constant discomfort or intermittent episodes of sharp pain. Reduced mobility in the neck, with difficulty turning or tilting the head sideways, is also common among those suffering from neck pain.

The sensation of numbness or tingling in the arms and hands can be another manifestation of this type of pain, possibly indicating the presence of nerve compression in the cervical region. In addition, some individuals may experience a decrease in grip strength and motor coordination due to the involvement of nerves radiating from the cervical spine to the upper extremities.

Lack of restful sleep can also be linked to neck and head pain. Affected individuals may experience difficulty falling asleep or waking up frequently during the night due to discomfort in the cervical area. This relationship between cervical pain and poor sleep can contribute to a negative cycle, as the lack of adequate rest can worsen existing symptoms. Early identification of symptoms and taking measures to address the underlying causes can be crucial to preventing long-term complications and improving the quality of life for those suffering from neck and head pain. That's why at our Chiropractic Center, we help alleviate pain through specific adjustments.

types.title: Types of Headache Related to Neck Pain
types.description:
Tension Headaches

Caused by tension in the muscles of the neck and upper back, these headaches can be constant and generate a feeling of pressure in the head. Tension headaches are often described as a tight band around the head or a feeling of tightness.

In addition to head pain, those suffering from tension headaches often report sensitivity in the scalp, neck muscles, and shoulders. Constant pressure in these areas can contribute to the onset of neck stiffness, amplifying the experienced discomfort.

It is important to note that, although tension headaches are a common cause of neck-related head pain, there are other types of headaches and cervical problems that may require specific care approaches. Therefore, their assessment is essential to determine the underlying cause and design a personalized care plan. That's why at ColumnaQuiro, we study each patient individually and personalized.

Cervical Migraines:

Characterized by a sharp and pulsating pain, often associated with changes in posture or neck movements. Unlike conventional migraines, cervical migraines originate in the cervical region and can radiate towards the head, causing intense and debilitating pain.

These migraines are often triggered by irritation of cervical structures, such as nerves and joints. The relationship between the neck and cervical migraines has led to the identification of specific triggers, such as sudden neck movements, sustained poor postures, and previous cervical traumas.

Additional symptoms of cervical migraines may include sensitivity to light and sound, nausea, and even vomiting. Unlike tension headaches, cervical migraines tend to be more disabling and can last for hours or even days, significantly affecting the quality of life of those who experience them.

It is essential for individuals experiencing cervical migraines to seek evaluation, as care can vary depending on the underlying cause and the severity of symptoms. Ignoring these episodes of pain can lead to a decrease in quality of life and negatively impact overall well-being. At our Chiropractic Center, we care for cervical migraines by applying a specific technique.

chiropracticBenefits.title: Chiropractic Benefits for Neck and Head Pain
chiropracticBenefits.description:
Chiropractic addresses the underlying cause of pain through specific adjustments. These adjustments aim to correct spinal alignment, thus reducing pressure on nerves and relieving muscle tension. Chiropractic focuses on the correction of spinal structure and the promotion of overall nervous system health, which can have positive impacts in the long term on quality of life. Chiropractic also emphasizes prevention, providing patients with tools and guidance to maintain proper posture and adopt healthy habits that reduce the likelihood of future episodes of neck and head pain. Chiropractors can offer personalized recommendations on workplace ergonomics, specific exercises, and lifestyle adjustments to support long-term neck health.

Why is Chiropractic a Better Alternative?

Unlike headache pills, which can have side effects and do not address the underlying cause, chiropractic offers a holistic approach. By improving the function of the spine and the nervous system, a sustainable reduction in the frequency and intensity of headaches can be experienced, without relying on medications.

Daily Headache and Chiropractic

For those facing daily headaches, chiropractic can offer significant relief. Chiropractic assessment identifies possible misalignments and tensions in the neck, allowing a personalized approach to reduce the frequency of headaches and improve quality of life.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Chiropractic for Neck and Head Pain

items.body: Yes, chiropractic is safe and non-invasive, providing a natural alternative to headache management.

items.title: How many chiropractic sessions are needed to see results?

items.title: Is chiropractic effective for daily headaches?
items.body: Yes, chiropractic can address the underlying causes of daily headaches, offering sustainable relief.

items.title: Can chiropractic be combined with other headache care?
items.body: Yes, chiropractic can complement other approaches to headache management, providing a comprehensive and personalized strategy.

whatIs.title: What is Sciatica?
whatIs.description: Sciatica is a medical condition that affects the sciatic nerve, which is the longest nerve in the human body. This nerve extends from the lower part of the spine, passing through the hips and the back of the legs, all the way to the feet. Sciatica occurs when this nerve is irritated or compressed, causing pain, numbness, tingling, or weakness in the affected area.

symptoms.title: Symptoms of Sciatica
symptoms.description:
Pain

It can range from mild to severe and may manifest as a sharp, burning pain, or as an electric shock-like sensation.

Numbness

Feeling of numbness or tingling radiating from the lower back to the affected leg.

Muscle weakness

Difficulty moving the affected leg or lifting the foot.

It is important to note that sciatica can vary in intensity and duration, and can be intermittent or constant. Additionally, factors such as age, lifestyle, physical activity, and overall health can influence the likelihood of developing this condition. If you experience symptoms of sciatica, it is essential to seek medical attention for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment plan.

types.title: Types of Sciatica and Their Variants
types.description:
There are different types of sciatica, classified according to the underlying cause of irritation or compression of the sciatic nerve. Some of the most common types include:

  1. Herniated Disc:

    Occurs when the soft material of the intervertebral disc shifts and presses on the sciatic nerve.

  2. Spinal Stenosis:

    Narrowing of the spinal canal that puts pressure on the sciatic nerve.

  3. Spondylolisthesis:

    Displacement of a vertebra that compresses the sciatic nerve.

  4. Injuries or Trauma:

    Such as falls, blows, or accidents that can damage the sciatic nerve.

  5. Piriformis Syndrome:

    Irritation or spasm of the piriformis muscle, which can compress the sciatic nerve.

chiropracticBenefits.title: Discovering the Benefits of Chiropractic Care for Sciatica
chiropracticBenefits.description:
1. Pain Relief:

    Chiropractic adjustments can help alleviate pressure on the sciatic nerve, thus reducing pain associated with this condition.

  2. Improved Mobility:

    Chiropractic treatments can help improve spinal and joint mobility, which can reduce stiffness and enhance movement capability.

  3. Inflammation Reduction:

    Chiropractic care may help reduce inflammation in the tissues surrounding the sciatic nerve, which can contribute to quicker recovery.

  4. Holistic Approach:

    Chiropractors focus on addressing the underlying cause of sciatica rather than just treating symptoms, which may lead to long-term improvement and prevention of future episodes.

  5. Personalized Treatment:

    Chiropractors conduct detailed assessments to develop an individualized treatment plan tailored to each patient's specific needs, which can maximize results.

It is important to note that the benefits of chiropractic care may vary for each individual, and it is essential to consult with a qualified chiropractor to determine if this approach is suitable for treating sciatica.

items.title: Can chiropractic care treat sciatica?
items.body: Yes, chiropractic care can be effective in treating sciatica. Chiropractors perform manual adjustments of the spine and other joints to relieve pressure on the sciatic nerve, which can reduce pain and improve function.

items.title: Is it safe to receive chiropractic treatment for sciatica?
items.body: In general, chiropractic care is considered a safe treatment option for sciatica, especially when performed by a qualified and licensed chiropractor. However, like with any medical treatment, there are certain risks and potential side effects, so it is important to discuss any concerns with your chiropractor before starting treatment.

items.title: How long does it take to see results with chiropractic care for sciatica?
items.body: The amount of time needed to see results with chiropractic care can vary for each individual and the severity of sciatica. Some people experience immediate relief after a single treatment, while others may require multiple sessions to achieve significant results. Your chiropractor will be able to provide a more accurate estimate after evaluating your specific situation.

items.title: What are the most common causes of sciatica?
items.body: Sciatica can be caused by various medical conditions, with the most common being herniated disc, spinal stenosis, piriformis syndrome, traumatic injuries, and vertebral displacement. Occasionally, sciatica can also result from diseases such as diabetes or cancer.

seo.title: What is Chiropractic? | ColumnaQuiro
seo.description: Improve with chiropractic: focused on enhancing the functionality of the nervous system. Chiropractic adjustments for stress, pain, and other symptoms.

intro.title: Chiropractic and the Nervous System
intro.description:
Chiropractic is a health profession that focuses on improving the functionality of the nervous system and the body as a whole through a comprehensive and holistic approach.

The nervous system is the first system to develop in the body, coordinating every organ, muscle, gland, and cell so that each can function in perfect synchrony.

The brain constantly receives information from the external and internal world, and thanks to the functioning of the nervous system, it can adequately respond to the needs of the moment, sending information back to the body. This process involves constant optimal adaptation of the body, commonly called health.

This connection between the brain and the rest of the body is crucial for regulating stress, pain, and other symptoms that may appear in other systems.

The Central Nervous System (CNS), composed of the brain and the spinal cord, is the only organ in the body that is completely protected by a layer of bone: the skull protects the brain, and the spine protects the spinal cord. We can imagine the spinal cord as a highway that transports all the information from the body to the brain and vice versa, being an essential element for the proper functioning of the nervous system.

interferences.title: Why Do I Have Nervous Interferences in My Body?
interferences.subtitle: Our body constantly adapts to various types of stress every day to keep us in an optimal state.

items.title: Physical Stress
items.body: Due to accidents, impacts, heavy falls, lifting weight incorrectly, maintaining bad postures for extended periods, childbirth, or practicing elite sports.

items.title: Emotional Stress
items.body: Caused by human relationships, chronic nervousness, economic concerns, family exhaustion, employment, the relationship with a partner, difficulty managing children, and relationships with friends.

items.title: Chemical Stress
items.body: In our lifestyle, we often lack time and frequently resort to quick solutions, exposing us to a large number of toxins. For example, in fast food, environmental pollution, beauty products, or cleaning products.

nervousSystem.title: How Does Chiropractic Work with the Nervous System?
nervousSystem.body:
Chiropractors are trained professionals to analyze, detect, and correct nervous interferences through specific, safe, and non-invasive manual adjustments. These interferences can affect communication between the brain and the body, hindering its proper functioning.

One of the main objectives of chiropractic is to maintain good communication between the central nervous system (brain and spine) and the rest of the body.

Chiropractic adjustments are mainly performed on the spine and consist of high-velocity, low-amplitude impulses that stimulate nerve receptors in the body.

As certified professionals, we ensure that each adjustment is specific, painless, and safe for the patient.

seo.title: Chiropractic for Everyone? - Comprehensive Approach - ColumnaQuiro
seo.description: Discover if chiropractic is right for you. Our approach improves the health of athletes, active individuals, and those seeking relief from chronic pain.

chiropracticForWhom.title: For Everyone
chiropracticForWhom.description:
At Columna Quiro, our goal is to help families live a full and healthy life. We are confident that when the body is well connected, both you and your family will be better prepared to face any challenges life presents, from daily stress to achieving optimal health.

Our safe and effective chiropractic adjustments focus on improving the health and well-being of the entire family. From infants to seniors, we offer personalized solutions tailored to the individual needs of each patient.

At Columna Quiro, we are dedicated to providing the best chiropractic care to help families enjoy a more active, happy, and healthy life. Join us on this journey to health and well-being!

description.disabled: Chiropractic improves mobility, balance, and coordination in people with disabilities. It also enhances development in neurobehavioral disorders.
description.kids: Prevent dysfunction in your baby's nervous system: how an optimal nervous system improves sensory and motor development, coordination, and senses.
description.elder: Improve mobility, balance, and quality of life in old age with Chiropractic: enjoy a healthy and active lifestyle thanks to its approach.
description.pregnant: Optimize your health during and after pregnancy with chiropractic care. Prepare your body for the physical, chemical, and emotional changes of pregnancy.
description.workers: Improve work performance with Chiropractic: adjustments positively affect decision-making, cognition... reducing absences due to health issues.
description.sport: Enhance athletic performance with chiropractic care. Adjustments increase strength, reaction time, mobility, balance, and post-training recovery.

description.disabled: People with motor or intellectual disabilities often have limited access to therapies. Chiropractic, by working holistically on the entire body, can improve body awareness, mobility, functionality, balance, and coordination. Numerous studies on chiropractic and the brain have shown its potential to produce changes in brain plasticity. In particular, chiropractic adjustments can balance different areas of the brain and improve development in people with neurobehavioral disorders.
description.kids:
During birth, the baby experiences stress, from descent in the birth canal to emergence into the unknown external world. During this process, the baby may get stuck in a position or encounter obstacles that hinder their exit. This can be reflected in the baby's unusual head shape at birth or a preferred side for breastfeeding. These efforts can cause dysfunction in their nervous system.

From birth to development, the baby must go through different stages in a specific order. These stages are synonymous with good sensory and motor development: motor development will allow them to have proper musculature and body coordination, while sensory development will allow them to develop all their senses (vision, smell, touch, etc.).

A 100% functioning nervous system will help the baby overcome these stages, improving their coordination, balance, and all their senses.
description.elder: In our society, although common, it is not normal for old age to be associated with weakness, slowness, illness, and dependence. It is important to note that with age, our body undergoes changes, such as the loss of quality in bones, collagen, and muscle fibers, and our quality of life may be affected. However, this stage is as important as any other, and it is essential to take care of our body to fully enjoy life. Chiropractic can help improve your mobility, balance, and lifestyle in a holistic and vitalistic way, promoting an active and healthy lifestyle.
description.pregnant:
Before and During Pregnancy

It is important to prepare the body for the changes that will occur during pregnancy:
  • Physical changes: alteration of the center of gravity affects posture and muscle tension.
  • Chemical changes: hormonal changes increase the laxity of ligaments and joints.
  • Emotional changes: becoming a mother is a significant step that can generate stress and questions for the expectant mother.

These changes can interfere with the nervous system, which controls all other systems of the body, including muscles, ligaments, and joints, such as the muscles and ligaments of the pelvic floor, the sacroiliac joint, and the coccyx. Chiropractic can help align the pelvis and spine so that the baby has enough space, and the mother can experience a more effective pregnancy. Therefore, we understand that the health of a pregnant woman is very important for her and the baby.

We are certified in the Webster technique, a chiropractic technique that focuses on the analysis and alignment of the pelvis and its muscles and ligaments to optimize the pelvic function of the mother during pregnancy and childbirth, reducing the need for medications or surgical interventions during childbirth.

After Childbirth

Childbirth is a physically stressful event (hours of contractions, baby's delivery), chemical (hormonal changes with increased milk), and emotional (arrival of the baby, being a mother, postpartum). Chiropractic can help improve postpartum recovery, allowing the body to function better so you can fully enjoy this new chapter in your life.
description.workers:
Chiropractic and its impact on the brain have been the subject of numerous studies, demonstrating the ability of adjustments to influence brain plasticity. Specifically, chiropractic adjustments increase activity in the prefrontal cortex.

The prefrontal cortex is involved in four key aspects: decision-making, cognition (information processing), social behavior, and personality expression. These aspects, improved by chiropractic adjustments, contribute to better work performance, including: greater efficiency, faster reaction time, optimal social performance, and reduced stress level.

In the long term, chiropractic in the workplace brings a series of benefits in absences due to health reasons, such as depression, back pain, and headaches. It also improves employee retention by allowing workers to better manage stress and other symptoms, leading to overall better work performance.
description.sport:
When it comes to regular or elite athletes, we often think of possible injuries or symptoms related to their activities, but not their athletic performance. Chiropractic has been used by many professional athletes and is recognized as a complementary form of healthcare for athletes. For example, Usain Bolt has been adjusted before his competitions.

Despite being little known in the sports world, chiropractic has been the subject of many studies that have shown that regular adjustments can improve:
  • Strength
  • Reaction time
  • Mobility
  • Balance
  • Post-training recovery

These parameters are crucial for enhancing athletic abilities.

seo.title: Frequently asked questions about Chiropractic | ColumnaQuiro
seo.description: Answers to Your Questions about Chiropractic and Our Chiropractic Center in Valencia: Services, Comprehensive Approach, and How to Improve Your Health.

sections.title: Chiropractic
sections.body: Frequently asked questions about chiropractic and its practice

faqs.title: Requirements and training process to become a chiropractor
faqs.body: To become a chiropractor, obtaining a university degree in Chiropractic and a Doctorate in Chiropractic is required, after completing a 5 to 7-year study program. Both degrees are recognized by the European Council on Chiropractic Education (ECCE). The career's beginning is similar to medicine, as disciplines like anatomy, radiology, epidemiology, nutrition, and pathophysiology are studied, with a specific focus on each population type, including babies, pregnant women, seniors, and athletes. Throughout the career, knowledge in chiropractic techniques is also acquired. The last two years are dedicated to practical experience, where students become interns in the school clinic under faculty supervision, attending patients of different ages and profiles to gain comprehensive experience before graduation.

faqs.title: Importance of preventive chiropractic care for maintaining health
faqs.body: Health cannot be defined solely as the absence of pain or symptoms. Adopting a preventive approach involves making proactive decisions that allow us to limit disease and optimize our health before symptoms appear. Preventive chiropractic care plays a fundamental role in addressing imbalances and dysfunctions in the body before they manifest as pain or evident symptoms. By maintaining a healthy nervous system and proper spinal alignment, we can promote optimal body function, prevent future problems, and improve overall quality of life.

faqs.title: What is chiropractic, and why should I consider chiropractic maintenance?
faqs.body: Chiropractic is a health profession that focuses on promoting the proper functioning of the nervous system and the body as a whole. Its goal is not just to relieve symptoms but to achieve a healthy body free of nerve interference. Chiropractic maintenance is recommended to preserve and improve current health, prevent relapses, and address stress factors that may affect the nervous system and the body in general. Regular chiropractic treatments aim to maintain proper spinal alignment and strengthen the body to prevent future complications.

faqs.title: Recognition of chiropractic and its development in Spain
faqs.body: Chiropractic is recognized by the World Health Organization (WHO) as a global health profession, ranking third after conventional medicine and dentistry. While chiropractic has its origins in the United States, it has developed widely in advanced countries like Australia and Europe. In Spain, chiropractic is experiencing gradual growth with the support of the Spanish Chiropractic Association (AEQ). It is essential to ensure that the chiropractor you visit is a member of the AEQ, the only entity guaranteeing chiropractic diplomas and regulating the profession in Spain. The growing presence and endorsement of the AEQ provide more confidence to those seeking chiropractic services in Spain, and as chiropractic consolidates in the country, more people are expected to benefit from its holistic approaches to health and well-being.

faqs.title: Types of stress affecting our body and how we adapt to them
faqs.body: Our body constantly faces different types of stress to keep us in an optimal state. There are three main types of stress: physical, chemical, and emotional. Chiropractic can play a significant role in helping the body adapt to and recover from stress by improving the function of the nervous system. Recognizing these different types of stress and understanding how our body adapts to them is crucial. Chiropractic can contribute to the body's adaptation and recovery from stress by enhancing the function of the nervous system, promoting balance, and overall health.

faqs.title: What is your training and experience as a chiropractor?
faqs.body: I graduated from the Barcelona College of Chiropractic in 2021 after completing a 6-year program. I began my first two years of study at IFEC in France and then decided to move to Spain. During my training, I also had the opportunity to work as a technique teacher and clinic supervisor at the Barcelona College of Chiropractic. After obtaining my diploma, I worked in a chiropractic practice in Barcelona, applying my knowledge and skills in chiropractic care. I have attended numerous seminars and chiropractic courses during and after my studies, allowing me to expand my knowledge and incorporate various techniques for personalized patient care. Some of the adjustment techniques I use include SOT (Sacro Occipital Technique), Applied Kinesiology, Gonstead, Total Body Modification, Toggle Recoil-Hole in One Technique, and Webster Technique. Each of these techniques has its characteristics and approaches, and I adapt them based on the individual needs of each patient. My goal is to provide comprehensive and effective chiropractic care to help restore balance and promote health and well-being in each person I treat. If you have specific questions about the techniques I use or are interested in learning more, feel free to ask.

sections.title: Chiropractic Adjustments
sections.body: Frequently asked questions about chiropractic adjustments

faqs.title: How long will it take to see results and improvements in my health?
faqs.body: The perception of changes can vary from person to person, as each body has its own capacity for expression and recovery. As chiropractors, our goal is to establish a care plan tailored to the individual needs of each patient, including analyzing different tests during the first visit. Some symptoms or conditions may improve after a few sessions, while more chronic conditions may require more time. It's important to collaborate in your own health by following the recommended care plan for excellent and lasting results. We will also conduct regular reviews to monitor your progress and adjust the care plan as needed to ensure you feel your best and experience health improvements. Remember that each case is unique, and results may vary. Our commitment is to provide you with the best care and work together to help you achieve your health goals. If you have any questions or concerns about your progress during chiropractic treatment, feel free to contact our team. We are here to support you on your journey to better health.

faqs.title: Is it safe to visit the chiropractor during pregnancy and for children?
faqs.body: Yes, it is safe to visit the chiropractor during pregnancy and for children. In our center, we have specialized training and courses in pediatrics to attend to children, as well as certification in the Webster Technique for pregnant women. Each adjustment technique we apply is extremely gentle and adapted to the spinal column of people of different ages, including children. We also consider the changes that occur in the body during pregnancy, ensuring a safe approach tailored to the needs of pregnant women. Many parents choose to bring their children to the chiropractor to correct any back or cranial dysfunction and improve overall health. Identifying and addressing these dysfunctions at an early age can contribute to the proper development of the child in later stages of life. In the case of pregnancy, chiropractic care can provide many benefits in preparing for childbirth and the proper development of pregnancy, helping to maintain good health and reduce dysfunction in the mother. If you have more questions or want more information about chiropractic care during pregnancy or for children, feel free to consult with our chiropractic team. We are here to provide the right care and support during these special stages of life.

faqs.title: What reactions might I experience after receiving chiropractic treatment?
faqs.body: After receiving chiropractic treatment, you may experience different reactions in your body. These reactions are normal and part of the healing and adjustment process of the nervous system. Some possible responses you could experience include a sense of relief, internal changes, and temporary fatigue or discomfort. Each person may have a different experience after chiropractic treatment, as each body reacts uniquely. If you have specific concerns or questions about the reactions you are experiencing, we recommend consulting with your chiropractor, who can provide additional guidance and support. Remember that these changes and reactions are part of your recovery process, and your chiropractor is there to help you at each stage of the journey toward better health and well-being.

faqs.title: Are chiropractic adjustments painful?
faqs.body: No, chiropractic adjustments are not painful. In fact, most people experience a sense of relaxation and reduced tension after chiropractic adjustments. The adjustments focus on the spine and are performed using quick, low-amplitude impulses that stimulate the body's nerve receptors. These adjustments are designed to restore the proper balance and alignment of the spine, relieving pressure and nerve interference. During the adjustment, you may hear a sound similar to a crack. This sound is due to the release of gases in the joints, a result of pressure changes during the adjustment. It's essential to note that this sound is not indicative of pain or joint damage. Each person may experience the sensations of chiropractic adjustments differently. Open communication with your chiropractor is crucial, and expressing any concerns or sensitivities you may have is encouraged. Chiropractic is a safe and effective practice for improving health and nervous system function without causing unnecessary pain. If you have additional questions or want to know more about chiropractic adjustments, feel free to consult with your chiropractor.

faqs.title: What causes the 'crack' sound during chiropractic adjustments?
faqs.body: The 'crack' sound during chiropractic adjustments is not the result of bones breaking. Instead, this sound is due to the phenomenon of cavitation, which occurs when synovial fluid in the joints is subjected to pressure, causing the vaporization of gases like nitrogen, oxygen, and carbon dioxide. This sudden release of gases is what generates the characteristic sound. It's important to emphasize that the 'crack' sound doesn't necessarily indicate a successful or beneficial adjustment. This sound is simply a natural consequence of synovial fluid cavitation and is not directly related to the proper functioning of the joint. The sound cannot be reproduced immediately, as gases naturally reorganize and dissolve back into the joint fluid as pressure increases. While joint cracking can occur naturally during movements like bending or moving the hands, deliberately cracking joints, like fingers, is not recommended. It can lead to dependence and is not related to the benefits of chiropractic adjustments performed by a trained professional. If you have additional questions or want more information about the 'crack' sound during chiropractic adjustments, we recommend consulting with your chiropractor for a more detailed and personalized explanation.

sections.title: Our Services
sections.body: Frequently asked questions about the services we offer at our ColumnaQuiro center in Valencia

faqs.title: How long will my first visit and regular adjustments take?
faqs.body: During your first visit, we will dedicate all the necessary time to collect the information we need and perform examination tests. We will focus on your first visit results to get a precise idea of your case and spinal dysfunctions. This visit usually lasts about 60 minutes. During this time, we will make sure to listen to your concerns, gather your medical history, and perform the necessary assessments to design a personalized care plan. As for regular adjustments, they are performed in a closed room and tailored to the specific needs of your body. Their duration typically ranges between 15 and 20 minutes. Throughout the treatment process, we will conduct reviews by comparing your initial test results with current ones to assess your improvements and adjust your care plan as needed. These reviews allow us to monitor your progress and ensure you are receiving the most suitable care at each stage of your treatment. Our goal is to provide you with quality and personalized care tailored to your individual needs. If you have additional questions about the duration of visits or the process of treatment, feel free to contact our team. We are here to provide you with the best chiropractic care possible.

faqs.title: Can I bring my child to the chiropractic consultation?
faqs.body: Absolutely! In our center, we welcome the whole family. We love to see children, no matter their age, and you can bring your child to our consultation. We want everyone to feel comfortable and welcome. We have designed a waiting room specifically equipped with games for the little ones to have fun while waiting for their turn. We want the experience to be enjoyable for both parents and children. We understand that parents also need to take care of themselves and address their own health and wellness needs. Therefore, we encourage you to schedule an appointment with us to receive the chiropractic care you need. We are here to help you maintain and improve your overall health. If you have additional questions about how we care for children in our consultation or if you want to schedule an appointment for yourself or your family, feel free to contact us. We will be happy to assist you.

seo.title: Team Chiropractic Center in Valencia | ColumnaQuiro
seo.description: Meet our team of highly trained professionals dedicated to improving your health and well-being. Start your journey to a healthier life today.

items.name: LÃ©a Guido
items.description:
I was born in the CÃ´te d'Azur, in the south of France, and have always felt a great passion for the human body and its incredible healing power through natural processes. I am a sports enthusiast and have always been very active in my life, so I understand the importance of having a healthy, adaptable body that functions at its maximum potential.

Since birth, I have had various health problems related to the musculoskeletal system, which prevented me from playing sports and climbing stairs at the age of 13. By chance, I ended up in a manual therapy center in France where I noticed significant improvements in my health and overall well-being.

That's when I decided to study a profession related to manual therapies, and upon discovering the philosophy of chiropractic, I knew that helping create a healthier, sustainable, and happier humanity through chiropractic care would be my calling.

After six years of studies between France (two years) and Barcelona (four years), I graduated in 2021 from the Barcelona College of Chiropractic. Since then, I have collaborated in different clinics, learning from the masters of the profession and practicing with different techniques and approaches in Barcelona and the province of Barcelona (Terrassa). I have also been an assistant teacher in different technique classes and a supervisor at the clinic of the Barcelona College of Chiropractic, as I have always enjoyed teaching and helping as many people as possible.

Since my graduation, I have continued to educate myself to expand my knowledge and skills to offer the best care to my patients. Recently, I have specialized in a holistic approach for pregnant women and children, allowing me to provide more comprehensive and personalized care to these populations.

For me, ColumnaQuiro goes beyond being a chiropractic center. It is a humanistic project that empowers the population from the inside out, helping each individual understand that health comes from within and its importance.

I am excited to welcome everyone seeking a natural and effective way to improve their health at ColumnaQuiro, and I look forward to helping them with open arms!

firstVisit.title: How Does It Work?
firstVisit.description:
Welcome to ColumnaQuiro! Our goal is to provide you with the best personalized chiropractic care. The first visit is crucial in our clinic to offer you the best chiropractic care possible.

Before your first visit, we will send you an online questionnaire to understand your current health concerns and goals, allowing us to better grasp your needs before the chiropractic session.

Now, let us explain what we will do during the first visit; we focus on this stage to monitor and assess your progress throughout chiropractic care:

steps.text: Review your health history with you to ensure we have all the necessary information.
Neurological testing with our tool to assess the functioning of your nervous system.
Evaluation of your gait pattern, balance, and coordination, and proper integration of your reflexes.
Posture evaluation through our postural analysis program.
Evaluation of your joint range of motion.
Specific palpation on your skull and vertebral segments.

firstVisit.footer:
Based on the information gathered, we will create a personalized care plan tailored to your needs, including my best recommendations. In some cases, X-rays may be required for a more comprehensive understanding of your condition.

In the first chiropractic session, we will begin implementing the specific care plan for you, so you can start experiencing positive changes in your health from the outset. After your initial consultation, we will schedule another appointment to review the results of your study and provide you with a comprehensive Digital Report.

At ColumnaQuiro, we focus on results. That's why we conduct periodic reviews to assess the objective changes you have experienced under our chiropractic care. These reviews also allow us to ensure that you are satisfied with the treatment you have received at all times.

During each review, we will discuss with you the appropriate strategies to achieve all your health and lifestyle goals. Our goal is to help you achieve optimal long-term health so you can enjoy a fuller and more active life. We are here to assist you on your journey to health and well-being!

You can enjoy a refreshing glass of water and delve into our selection of health books while waiting for your consultation. Here, your well-being is our absolute priority.

We are committed to making your experience as comfortable and relaxing as possible.

Thank you for trusting us to take care of you!

firstVisitRoom.title: First Visit Room
firstVisitRoom.description:
In our first visit room, your privacy and comfort are our top priorities.

Here, we dedicate the necessary time to conduct a thorough and personalized chiropractic assessment, deeply understanding your individual needs.

This environment is carefully designed to ensure your tranquility and confidentiality as we together chart the path to optimal well-being.

At every step, your health and satisfaction are our greatest concerns.

adjustmentRoom.title: Adjustment Room
adjustmentRoom.description:
Welcome to our adjustment room, where your well-being comes to life.

In this space, our expert chiropractors are dedicated to providing you with personalized and highly effective care. It's the place where we alleviate your discomforts and work tirelessly to enhance your quality of life.

Here, in our care oasis, we welcome you to your journey toward health. We are committed to guiding you toward a healthier and discomfort-free life.

Your well-being is our priority, and we are here to accompany you at every step toward a better quality of life.

library.title: Our Multilingual Health Library
library.description:
Our bookshelf is a treasure trove of knowledge in multiple languages: French, Spanish, and English.

Here, you'll find a diverse selection of books on health and chiropractic topics. The best part is you can take these treasures home with you.

Enrich your mind and broaden your horizons as you delve into wellness and self-care subjects. These books are available to you so you can continue your quest for knowledge at home.

Explore, learn, and grow with us!
